name: Kerala

name: Vetnam
overview: Explore the vibrant cities and stunning landscapes of Vietnam on this 9-day journey. Start in Hanoi with city tours and a serene Halong Bay cruise. Continue to Danang and Hoi An for cultural experiences, ancient towns, and the spectacular Golden Bridge at Ba Na Hills. Fly to Ho Chi Minh City to discover historic landmarks and enjoy a relaxing Mekong Delta cruise. This tour blends history, culture, nature, and local life for an unforgettable Vietnamese adventure.

Day 2: Hanoi City Tour.

Day 6: Danang - Ba Na Hills with Golden Bridge ‚Äì Da Nang.
Day 7: Da Nang ‚Äì Flight to Ho Chi Minh city.
Day 8: Ho Chi Minh City ‚Äì Afternoon city tour.
Day 9: Ho Chi Minh ‚Äì Mekong Delta ‚Äì My Tho ‚Äì Ho Chi Minh .
Day 10: Departure from Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Char Dham
overview:
Chardham, meaning "Four Abodes," is a sacred pilgrimage circuit in the Indian Himalayas, encompassing four holy shrines: Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath. Nestled amidst the majestic mountains of Uttarakhand, these sites hold immense spiritual significance in Hinduism. Pilgrims visit Chardham to seek divine blessings, perform rituals, and experience the serenity of the Himalayas.

Yamunotri: The source of the Yamuna River, known for its hot springs and temple dedicated to Goddess Yamuna.

Gangotri: The origin of the sacred Ganges River, with the temple dedicated to Goddess Ganga.

Kedarnath: Famous Shiva temple located near the Mandakini River, surrounded by snow-capped peaks.

Badrinath: Dedicated to Lord Vishnu, one of the holiest Vaishnavite shrines in India.

The Chardham pilgrimage is not only a spiritual journey but also a breathtaking adventure through valleys, rivers, and mountains, attracting devotees and travelers alike.

name: Shri Mata Vaishno Devi
overview: Mata Vaishno Devi is a revered Hindu pilgrimage site located in the Trikuta Mountains near Katra, Jammu & Kashmir. It is dedicated to Goddess Vaishno Devi, believed to fulfill devotees‚Äô wishes. The shrine is accessible via a 14 km trek(Approx) and attracts millions of pilgrims every year. The journey combines devotion with scenic mountain views.
itinerary:
Day 1: Arrival & Trek to Mata Vaishno Devi.

Arrive at Katra (base town).
Check-in at hotel and rest briefly.
Start the trek to Vaishno Devi Temple (14 km)Approx. Options: walk, pony.
Darshan at Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine.
Return to Katra for overnight stay.

Day 2: Optional Nearby Excursions / Relax.
Early in the morning, after breakfast, you will travel by helicopter other.its Subject to availability.
Sanji Chhat or Ardh Kuwari Cave
Evening free for shopping or rest in Katra.
Overnight stay in Katra.

Day 3: Departure.

Check out from hotel.
Optional visit to Raghunath Temple in Jammu if time permits.
Depart for your onward journey (train, bus, or flight).

name: Baku Tour
overview: Experience the beauty of Azerbaijan on this 5-day Baku journey. Start with a warm welcome and panoramic evening tour of Highland Park, Flame Towers, and the city lights. Discover the charm of Baku‚Äôs Old City, the stunning Heydar Aliyev Center, and the Caspian Boulevard. Travel to Gabala to enjoy the Tufandaq Mountain Resort and peaceful Nohur Lake. Explore the Fire Temple of Ateshgah, the blazing Yanardag Mountain, and shop at Ganjlik Mall. End your trip with the historic Qobustan rock carvings and a relaxing visit to Deniz Mall before departing from Baku.
itinerary:
Day 1: Arrive in Baku, transfer to hotel. Enjoy an evening panoramic city tour visiting Highland Park, Flame Towers, and Alley of Martyrs. Dinner at an Indian restaurant.

Day 2: Explore Baku‚Äôs Old City (Icheri Sheher), visit Maiden Tower and Shirvanshah Palace, photo stop at Heydar Aliyev Center, and stroll along Caspian Boulevard.

Day 3: Full-day Gabala tour ‚Äì visit Tufandaq Mountain Resort, enjoy cable car rides, and relax by the beautiful Nohur Lake. Return to Baku.

Day 4: Visit Ateshgah Fire Temple and Yanardag Fire Mountain. Enjoy shopping and leisure time at Ganjlik Mall.

Day 5: Discover Qobustan‚Äôs ancient rock carvings (UNESCO site) and spend the afternoon at Deniz Mall for shopping and entertainment.

Day 6: Breakfast at hotel and transfer to airport for departure

name: Georgia Tour
overview: Discover the beauty and history of Georgia with this 5-day journey through Tbilisi and its surroundings. Begin in Tbilisi, exploring the Holy Trinity Cathedral, Narikala Fortress, and the charming old streets of the capital. Travel along the scenic Georgian Military Highway to visit Ananuri Fortress, Gudauri, and the breathtaking Kazbegi mountains. Explore Mtskheta, Georgia‚Äôs spiritual heart, and Gori, the birthplace of Joseph Stalin. Visit Kakheti, the famous wine region, where you‚Äôll enjoy the ‚ÄúCity of Love‚Äù ‚Äì Sighnaghi, Bodbe Monastery, and local wine tasting. Conclude your memorable Georgian adventure with a smooth departure from Tbilisi.
itinerary:
Day 1: Arrival in Tbilisi, city tour including Holy Trinity Cathedral, Metekhi Church, Sulfur Baths, Sharden area, Narikala Fortress, and Bridge of Peace. Overnight in Tbilisi.

Day 2: Ananuri Fortress, Gudauri Ski Resort, Georgia-Russia Friendship Monument, and Kazbegi mountains. Overnight in Tbilisi.

Day 3: Visit Mtskheta ‚Äì Jvari Monastery, Svetitskhoveli Cathedral; Gori ‚Äì Stalin Museum and Gori Fortress. Overnight in Tbilisi.

Day 4: Kakheti wine region tour ‚Äì Sighnaghi, Bodbe Monastery, and KTW Wine Factory with wine tasting. Overnight in Tbilisi.

Day 5: Breakfast and transfer to Tbilisi airport for departure.

name: New Zealand
overview: Experience the best of New Zealand on this 15-day journey from the vibrant city of Auckland to the adventure hub of Queenstown. Explore the magical Hobbiton, geothermal wonders of Rotorua, and the art deco charm of Napier. Enjoy scenic ferry rides, whale watching in Kaikoura, and stargazing at Lake Tekapo. Discover the natural beauty of Milford Sound and immerse in Queenstown‚Äôs lakes, mountains, and gourmet experiences. This tour combines culture, adventure, and breathtaking landscapes for an unforgettable Kiwi adventure.
itinerary:
Day 1: Welcome to Auckland.
Day 2: Auckland to Matamata and Hobbiton, then travel from Matamata to Rotorua.
Day 3: Explore Rotorua and enjoy the Te Ra Daytime & Te Po Evening Experience Combo at Te Puia.
Day 4: Travel from Rotorua to Napier.
Day 5: Napier to Wellington City via Masterton.
Day 6: Interislander Ferry from Wellington to Picton.
Day 7: Blenheim to Kaikoura, including Ocean‚Äôs Cabin and Whale Watch Kaikoura.
Day 8: Travel from Kaikoura to Christchurch and enjoy the Christchurch Gondola.
Day 9: Christchurch to Lake Tekapo, with stargazing at Tekapo Springs.
Day 10: Travel from Lake Tekapo to Te Anau.
Day 11: Te Anau to Milford Sound and return, including a Milford Sound Cruise with Real NZ.
Day 12: Travel from Te Anau to Queenstown.
Day 13: Explore Queenstown and enjoy the TSS Earnslaw cruise to Walter Peak with a gourmet BBQ dinner and farm tour.
Day 14: Full day to explore Queenstown.
Day 15: Depart from Queenstown, farewell from New Zealand.

name: Leh Ladakh
overview:
Srinagar / Kargil / Leh / Nubra / Turtuk / Pangong / Leh

This 8-day Ladakh tour itinerary takes you on a breathtaking journey through the Himalayas ‚Äî from the serene valleys of Srinagar to the rugged landscapes of Leh and Kargil. Experience the natural beauty of Sonmarg, Zojila Pass, and Drass, along with spiritual visits to ancient monasteries like Lamayuru and Thiksey. Traverse the world‚Äôs highest motorable road to Nubra Valley, enjoy the unique double-humped camel rides, and witness the mesmerizing blue hues of Pangong Lake. The trip blends adventure, culture, and stunning scenery, offering an unforgettable glimpse into Ladakh‚Äôs mystic charm.
itinerary:
Day 1: Srinagar ‚Äì Kargil
Day 2: Kargil - Leh
Day 3: Leh ‚Äì City tour
Day 4: Leh to Nubra Valley
Day 5: Nubra Valley to Turtuk (A Day Excursion)
Day 6: Nubra Valley (Local Sightseeing) to Pangong Lake
Day 7: Pangong Lake to Leh
Day 8: Departure from Leh
